intro: Psychotria albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin'd psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking white margins on its dark green leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
